body:
Also a big thanks from me for uncovering this!

The problem is not that .stignore is not existing, but that the directory does not yet exist. If you create a new folder in a directory without .stignore everything works fine.
The error happens here:
https://github.com/syncthing/syncthing/blob/master/lib/osutil/atomic.go#L40

Two possible solutions:
When a folder is added check whether the directory exists and create it no matter whether the folder is paused or not.
Check whether the directory exists in `ignore.WriteIgnore` and create it if it doesn't.

@calmh Which do you prefer?

> On 13 Apr 2017, at 15:46, Simon Frei <notifications@github.com> wrote:
> 
> When a folder is added check whether the folder exists and create it no matter whether it is paused or not.

This sounds reasonable to me.

~I am struggling to find where/when a non-existing root directory is created when a new (unpaused) folder is added in a non-existing directory.~
found
Eh... Somewhere called from startfolder or the health check would be my guess

The whole thing is a bit convoluted and maybe involves the folder marker. The directory is [created only if there is no existing index](https://github.com/syncthing/syncthing/blob/master/lib/model/model.go#L242), I don't really understand why and what happens if there is already an index (possibly a missing folder marker error?).
If I would just create the directory in [CommitConfiguration](https://github.com/syncthing/syncthing/blob/master/lib/model/model.go#L2381) instead, this mechanism (whatever it is for) would be circumvented.
When adding the folder the error from the failing ignore due to the missing directory [is ignored](https://github.com/syncthing/syncthing/blob/master/lib/model/model.go#L328).

So while it would be easy to just create the directory, with my limited knowledge of the mechanisms during folder creation, I am unsure about what effects this might have and how to do it most consistently.

It certainly is a convoluted. The index thing is about detecting the difference between the folder not existing because it's entirely new and the folder being suddenly missing (which will indeed cause the folder marker missing thing).

We could do it when committing the configuration instead, probably. I don't think that mechanism existed or at least was built out when the current system was invented. We're old enough to have legacy code now... D:

Needs to still work when someone shuts down Syncthing and adds a folder to the config, but that's just a specific check at startup instead.

We might also get away with just creating the directory in commitconfiguration and leaving the rest intact. The folder marker check etc should still work as is.

So it should be fine to move only the directory creation from `startFolderLocked` to `CommitConfiguration`, as the folder marker will still be missing. Thus the folder marker missing error will still happen and everything is safe and backwards compatible (hopefully).
The only problem will be with folders added via modifying config.xml manually, and then starting syncthing.

That could be handled by only doing it for paused folders in `CommitConfiguration` and leaving `startFolderLocked` as is. But then this could still be a problem when there is a [paused folder in config.xml](https://github.com/syncthing/syncthing/blob/master/cmd/syncthing/main.go#L817) to which the path does not exist (can that even happen?). And maybe there is more places to be looked after I didn't see yet. Once again I feel this would be much easier/cleaner to handle if a paused folder would be added to the model, just not started.
